column2: officially the Municipality of Binalbagan (Hiligaynon: Banwa sang Binalbagan; Tagalog: Bayan ng Binalbagan)
column3: is a 1st class municipality in the province of Negros Occidental
column6: 270 people. Major economic activities include manufacturing
column9: cottage industries and tourism. Binalbagan is also known for the Binalbagan Isabela Sugar Company (BISCOM).

column1: Binalbagan became a town on May 15
column2: 1572 and was one of the first two settlements of Negros Occidental (the second being the municipality of Ilog). On the record
column3: Binalbagan is the oldest town in the whole Negros Island

column1: The municipality celebrates an annual fiesta called "The Balbagan Festival" every month of May.
Binalbagan is politically subdivided into 16 barangays: thirteen (13) rural barangays and three (3) urban barangays.
The people in the city speak the Hiligaynon language (often called Ilonggo). Filipino and English are generally understood.
